intro: Cyclostemon celebicus, commonly known as the Celebes cyclostemon, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian islands of Sulawesi and Buton. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and fragrant, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in lowland rainforests and is often found in secondary forests or disturbed areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species and is of interest for both ecological and horticultural studies.
